page.title: 04Some Natural Areas-W.Wickham
page.content: Our area is urban with owner-occu- pied family houses. There is much traf- fic in Pickhurst Lane and Westmoreland Road resulting in much pollution. There are four main conservation areas:Pick- hurst Park,which includes a small copse;Pickhurst Green with a wood and pond;Southill Woods and Pickhurst School grounds.Here there is a variety of trees and a pond.In all these places parts have been left wild for animals and birds to find homes. Elizabeth Holten, Pickhurst. High Broom Wood is a quiet, relaxing place.It contains much wildlife. Stick- leback, together with frogs and toads, live in and around the stream which it contains.There are many birds and foxes also. Sadly, we found a felled elm tree which had been infected with Dutch Elm Disease. Tim Harris, Oak Lodge.
